required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Pyrotinib in Combination With Capecitabine in Patients With Trastuzumab-resistant HER2-positive Advanced Breast Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: Phase II Study of Pyrotinib in Combination With Capecitabine in Patients With Trastuzumab-resistant HER2-positive Advanced Breast Cancer

brief_summary.textblock: Trastuzumab resistance, which is a common therapeutic challenge in HER2 positive metastatic breast cancer, is not fully understood. Pyrotinib is an oral tyrosine kinase inhibitor targeting EGFR, HER-2 and HER-4 receptors. More general inhibition of ErbB family with pyrotinib could provide additional benefit. This study is designed to evaluate the efficacy and safety of pyrotinib in combination with capecitabine in patients with HER2 positive locally advanced or metastatic breast cancer who had early failure on or after trastuzumab treatment.

detailed_description.textblock: A multi-center, one-arm, open label design study, which is planned to enroll 100 patients with trastuzumab-resistant HER2-positive advanced breast cancer.

primary_outcome.description: From enrollment to progression or death (for any reason)

secondary_outcome.description: Ratio of CR and PR in all subjects
The first evaluation of CR or PR to progression or death (for any reason)
Ratio of CR,PR and SD greater than or equal to 24 weeks in all subjects
From enrollment to death (for any reason)

secondary_outcome.measure: Adverse Events and Serious Adverse Events
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From informed consent through 28 days following treatment completion

arm_group.description: pyrotinib(400 mg once daily) + capecitabine (2000 mg/m^2 daily, 1000 mg/m^2 BID)

intervention.description: pyrotinib 400 mg once daily; Capecitabine 1000 mg/m2 per day on day 1 through 14, every 21 days.
